message.content:
cs.MM, cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.CV, cs.CR

Reasoning: 
- cs.MM (Multimedia): The paper proposes a new strategy for video streaming that aims to improve the Quality of Experience (QoE) of users. 
- cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture): The paper discusses the impact of TCP on HTTP-based video streaming and proposes a solution to avoid interruptions in case of sudden capacity loss. 
- cs.IT (Information Theory): The paper uses the Ballot theorem to analyze the QoE gain in terms of initial buffering time, re-buffering time, and content resolution. 
- cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition): The paper mentions the use of Scalable Video Coding (SVC) to add a time-shifted layer of redundancy to the video stream. 
- cs.CR (Cryptography and Security): Although not the main focus of the paper, the proposed strategy could have implications for security and privacy in video streaming.
